alston.minecraft

Class Light

  • java.lang.Object
    • alston.minecraft.Light
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Light
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A Object representation of a Point-Source Light, which propergates from the origin with a decay to the surrounding adjacent Blocks with a decay. This Light uses a "careful" brute force approach for it's algorithm.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Light

        public Light(Block origin,
     float intensity,
     float decay)
        Creates a new light at the specified location and properties.
        Parameters:
        origin - The Block where the light is being originated from
        intensity - The intensity of the light above AMBIENT
        decay - The decay of lighting per Block that the Light travels

    • Method Detail

      • addPernamentLight

        public static void addPernamentLight(Light light)
        Pernamently (until it is explicitly removed) adds the light.
        Parameters:
        light - The light to be added

      • removePernamentLight

        public static void removePernamentLight(Light light)
        Removes a pernament light.
        Parameters:
        light - The light to be removed

      • updateLights

        public static void updateLights()
        Starts a thread to update all lighting.

      • checkOnFuture

        public static void checkOnFuture()
        Checks on the future for the sunlight thread.

      • updateLighting

        public void updateLighting()
        Proprogates lighting thru the Blocks and applies it's effects to the Block's lightLevel value if it's high than it's current one. This is not done in the method itself, but simply triggers a recursive light propergating algrorithm starting at the light's origin.

      • factorInfluences

        public void factorInfluences(float factor)
        Multiplies the intensity of the Light by the given factor. This will change the intensity value and the multiple is only of the intensity value.
        Parameters:
        factor - A positive floating point value that will be the multiple of the intensity, with 1 being no change

      • getOrigin

        public Block getOrigin()
        Returns:
        The Block at which the light originated from.

      • getIntensity

        public float getIntensity()
        Returns:
        The intensity of this Light
